field.label: Upstream interface
field.help: Choose the uplink interface which receives the external IPv6 prefix from the ISP. Usually, this is the WAN interface.

field.label: Downstream interfaces
field.help: Choose one or multiple downlink interfaces which should proxy the upstream IPv6 prefix.

field.label: Proxy router advertisements
field.help: Proxy upstream RAs to downstream interfaces. Disable this if you use your own RA daemon.

field.label: Install host routes
field.help: Automatically create host routes for discovered clients. Disabling this means you must manually handle all routing decisions.

field.label: Maximum learned neighbors
field.help: Maximum learned neighbors, increase for large networks.

field.label: Max route operations
field.help: Max route operations per second, increase for large networks.

field.label: Packet capture timeout
field.help: Controls CPU usage vs. NDP responsiveness. Lower values (e.g., 25 ms) minimize latency during cache refresh at the cost of more CPU. Higher values (100â€“250 ms) reduce CPU use but may introduce small latency spikes.
